page.title: 15Housing
page.content: There are a few old houses in Skirlaugh, about 6% are over 100 years old, but most have been built in the last twenty years. There is no local stone because the whole area is made up of the muddy bottom of an ancient lake, so nearly all the houses are made of bricks. Also there is no slate so the roofing material is tile. The oldest houses are along the main road and along one street on either side of the cross roads. The new houses are on an estate round the school and further along the two side roads. We found out the ages of houses in the village and worked out a percentage for each age group. Over 100 yrs 6% 51 to 100 3% 21 to 50 26% 11 to 20 36% Under 10 yrs 29%
